owner.username: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

title._content: Pilot climbing the rope ladder of SS NEW AUSTRALIA, Ceylon

description._content: This image is one of a series taken by migrant Vaughan Evans during his voyage from England to Australia on board SS NEW AUSTRALIA in early 1955. Vaughan Evans OAM (1924-1993) came to Australia as a 'ten pound pom' and his lifelong passion for maritime history led him to found the Australian Association for Maritime History. Evans donated his extensive personal library to the Australian National Maritime Museum in 1986.

note._content: These are "wind scoops", a primitive form of air-conditioning. Sometimes made from aluminium, more usually fashioned from cardboard, fixed to an open port-hole they caught some breeze when the vessel was underway in the tropics.
note.author: 28846271@N06
